snippet: Corning agreed on Tuesday to buy the majority of a Becton Dickinson biosciences unit for about $730 million in cash. The unit includes businesses that make lab tools like Petri dishes and equipment to grow cells.
abstract: Corning agreed on Tuesday to buy the majority of a Becton Dickinson biosciences unit for about $730 million in cash. The unit includes businesses that make lab tools like Petri dishes and equipment to grow cells.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Corning to Buy Majority of a Becton Biosciences Division
